creator: josias.thoeny@wyona.org
text: The cocoon reload parameter should be disabled for security reasons.

Created attachment 17035
patch for cocoon local.build.properties
creator: josias.thoeny@wyona.org
josias.thoeny@wyona.org
text:
This should be fixed in trunk, too.
And isn't there a mechanism with revision numbers to ensure that cocoon has to
be rebuilt when the lenya/src/cocoon/local.build.properties change?

yes, there is a mechanism for local.blocks.properties, and we could introduce
the same for local.build.properties
creator: michi@apache.org

text:
please review this issue before 1.4.
i can't say how bad the security implications are, but we should think about it.
the cocoon wiki has a quick explanation of what the option does:
http://wiki.apache.org/cocoon/BuildProperties?highlight=%28allow-reloads%29

creator: andreas@apache.org
text:
(In reply to comment #4)
> yes, there is a mechanism for local.blocks.properties, and we could introduce
> the same for local.build.properties

Apparently this has been done:

  <!-- Check local.build.properties  -->
  <target name="check-build-properties" if="cocoon.build.webapp.dir.exists">
    <property file="${cocoon.src.dir}/local.build.properties"/>
